Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2009 02:39PM JuneR77 wrote: Thank you all for your comments. They have been extremely helpful. I don't feel so scared now and have a more positive attitude about the future.
Posts.Title: side effects for musicians JuneR77 apple

Posts.Content: JuneR77 wrote: I am a professional musician who plays the flute. I am probably going to be having a bilateral mastectomy and am worried that this will be the end of my career. How will this surgery effect the use of my arms and breathing in the long run?  When taking a deep breath I raise my rib cage and expand my chest.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: side effects for musicians JuneR77 apple

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2009 12:33PM JuneR77 wrote: This is encouraging.   Everyone's comments and suggestions have been very helpful and are helping me to come to some decisions. I will have my biopsy on March 3, with the results 48 hr. later. I'm planning for the worst.  One remaining question  is why it might not be possible for me to have  radiation instead of the mastectomy. I know that I have dense breast tissue and have been told that after radiation it becomes more difficult to pick up any other cancers.
